org.csapi.csapicore.core
Class SessionMgr

java.lang.Object
  org.csapi.csapicore.core.SessionMgr

public class SessionMgr
extends java.lang.Object

The SessionMgr class takes care of the communication with the server. It contains all needed information to handle a full session, from login to reports.

It also provides a single point of access to methods related to session handling, with items such as csapi_token. Since there is only one SessionMgr for the current eclipse session, the singleton design pattern is used.

For more information about the protocol used by the Telelogic Perl API, please refer to documentation on the project site.

Author:
Boris Baldassari

Method Detail

getDefault

public static SessionMgr getDefault()
The singleton accessor. Returns the shared instance or null if the object has not been initialized. This method is useless as long as a SessionMgr object has been initialized through the above constructor.

Returns:
The shared instance, null if the object has not been initialized.

getXMLLogin

private java.lang.String getXMLLogin()
Returns a ready-to-use xml string corresponding to a login attempt. This String can safely be sent through a socket to the Synergy/Change server.

Returns:
the xml string.

getXMLFindRecord

private java.lang.String getXMLFindRecord(java.lang.String query,
                                          java.lang.String attributes)
Returns a ready-to-use xml string corresponding to a record search. This String can safely be sent through a socket to the Synergy/Change server.

Parameters:
query - The query to be executed on the server.
attributes - The list of attributes to be retrieved, separated by pipes.
Returns:
The full xml string.

getConnection

private java.net.HttpURLConnection getConnection()
                                          throws PluginException
Creates the HTTP connection. Mostly useful to set correct headers.

Returns:
The connection to be used for communications.
Throws:
PluginException

connect

private SimpleSaxParser connect(java.lang.String xmlRequest)
                         throws PluginException
Connects to the server, sends the XML request furnished as parameter, reads feedback from server through a SimpleSaxParser and returns the corresponding object. It handles all the network-related stuff and provides a high level interface to methods like login() or getReport(String, String), which should not care about buffered readers.

Parameters:
xmlRequest - The XML full request to send to the server.
Returns:
A SimpleSaxParser object, containing XML analysis result.
Throws:
PluginException

login

public void login()
           throws PluginException
Login to the server and get the token identifying the user for this session. Must be the first method to be invoked, since the token is mandatory for any other action.

Throws:
PluginException

getReport

public Report getReport(java.lang.String query,
                        java.lang.String attributesList)
                 throws PluginException
Get a report, once login() has been done. If no csapiToken is available (i.e. the user is not logged in Change Synergy) returns a null report.

Parameters:
query - The query to execute on the server, as it would have been entered into the "Query" web interface.
attributesList - The list of attributes to retrieve, separated by pipes.
Returns:
A report containing all records returned by the server.
Throws:
PluginException

csapiDatabase - The csapiDatabase to set.
